body.name: Antec RGB GPU Support Bracket, Graphics Card Holder, Tempered Glass, Addressable RGB 5V 3PIN RGB Connector

features: The unique ARGB lighting on the tempered glass creates the sense of science and technology effect for the whole graphic cards.
Compatible with the MATX, ATX, ITX and long PSU bracket cases, it can fulfill users’ various needs.
Simple installation, no damage to the graphics card, can be adjusted according to the weight and size of different graphics cards.
The solid base is reinforced by a strong magnet to secure it in place. Ensure that the graphic card can have the most stable support under different layout modes.
body.description: Antec RGB Tempered Glass GPU Support Bracket Support Graphics Card & Enrich Chassis Edge-lit ARGB Tempered Glass CNC-machined tempered glass demonstrates ARGB lighting throughout the bracket. Versatile Support Height-adjustable supporting arm is available from 46 to 165mm, with 55mm depth, suits for various graphics card shape. Magnet Base Wide range magnetic base provides strong support for extra large graphic card. Daisy Chain Extension-able 3 pin ARGB port gives an easier way to integrate lighting effect.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Antec, Inc. is the global leader in high-performance computer components and accessories for the gaming, PC upgrade and Do-It-Yourself markets. Founded in 1986, Antec is recognized as a pioneer in the industry and has maintained its position as a worldwide market leader and international provider of quiet, efficient and innovative products. Antec has also achieved great success in the distribution channel, meeting the demands of quality-conscious system builders, VARs and integrators. Antec RGB Tempered Glass GPU Support Bracket Support Graphics Card & Enrich Chassis Edge-lit ARGB Tempered Glass CNC-machined tempered glass demonstrates ARGB lighting throughout the bracket. Versatile Support Height-adjustable supporting arm is available from 46 to 165mm, with 55mm depth, suits for various graphics card shape. Magnet Base Wide range magnetic base provides strong support for extra large graphic card. Daisy Chain Extension-able 3 pin ARGB port gives an easier way to integrate lighting effect.
WARNING Supporting arm must not access the graphics card fan.

Specifications Model Antec RGB Tempered Glass GPU Support Bracket Dimensions 20 x 67 x 213 mm (LxWxH) Height of Support Range 30 – 180 mm Depth of Support 40 mm Materials Tempered Glass + Aluminum Alloy LED Type 5V RGB (Available for M/B Sync) Connector 3-pin Male&Female Connector Net Weight 256 g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Craftmanship is superb!
reviews.reviewText: I hardly write a review, but I had to on this product. A couple of weeks ago, my machine started to all of a sudden power off during boot up. I thought it was my power supply giving up on me, however being a 4-year-old machine, decided to change it. My PC worked, and a couple of days later did the same. Powers on and about 2–3 seconds turns off. So, it was time to take parts one by one to determine which one was the culprit. Starting with the graphics card, I pulled it out, and my device booted perfectly. I was oh gosh - please not my 3070TI going bad, :( I reinsert my graphics card and my PC worked again. I was alright, it's not my 3070ti! But then 2 days later back again not booting, :( I remember reading an article in Tom's hardware that if you don't support the heavier cards properly they will begin over time to bend the PCI connector down. Well, that was my case. I started by lifting it up with a piece of foam and notice, I didn't have any more boot problems. I could have left it with the foam, but the aesthetics of my computer look bad with a piece of foam. Let me tell you my friends, this GPU holster is top quality and easy to install. You can daisy-chain it with your other RGB products and it looks awesome. No more lousy foam.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a great idea.
reviews.reviewText: Fit like a glove in my case . But I can see how this might not work in all computer cases . My case the power supply is mounted in the bottom with a shroud hiding the power supply that runs clear across the bottom of the case . That means My motherboard has a floor even with the shroud . So it works well in my case. Some computer cases have about 4 inches between the floor of the case and the motherboard . THAT will NOT work. You will need a taller support bracket , so choose wisely. Fit and Finnish were spot on , supported my 3060TI just fine . Easy to install .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A great GPU support, but doesn't fit a full tower case
reviews.reviewText: I use a Corasir Obsidian full tower case where I like to have room when rebuilding my system. This GPU support is not tall enough to reach my GPU (ASUS Tuf RTX 3080) without modifications. I was able to re-engineer the parts, remove the top support, and make it just barely tall enough to at least sit beneath one corner of my GPU.Otherwise, the support is precision machined, made of sturdy aluminium, comes with preapplied adhesive on the bottom of the stand, and include extra double-sided adhesives strips.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid GPU holder.
reviews.reviewText: Installs and works solidly as it should. Have it daisy chained with the case led and then using a 5v rgb header splitter with a lian li fan hub, directly interacts with the motherboard lighting control itself (more specially Gigabyte).Having my video card in a vertical position, it greatly helps reduce the slight sag it had where the vertical bracket ends prematurely. It just didn't look and feel right, and I really just wanted to prevent things from possibly escalating any further.Led-wise, it is very aesthetically pleasing to my eyes. It's a chunk of glass that lights up pretty much. Although if it isn't flush with your video card correctly, your card will simply slip off the small adjustable foot bar it has.The only bad things that I could really mention isn't due to the item itself though, using a Lian Li o11XL, the bottom isn't entirely flat after removing a case fan because you can't exactly fit its magnetic base atop a 120mm fan (or I was too lazy to think of a way). And underneath awaits a cutout base for a fan to give it some space for air i guess but took some finagling to have this item perfectly fit.Unifying led software is a pain, and I cannot place any blame on the item itself. Communicates with no problem to the Gigabyte Fusion software but had to use other software that not only communicates with lian li strimmers, fans, this thing, and razer accessiories, corsair ram, and through trial and error ended up using signal rgb.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy and looks good
reviews.reviewText: Good product for the price. Comes with enough parts to support 2 gpu’s. Fits nicely in my pc. Plugged right into my motherboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It holds, it lights.
reviews.reviewText: Looks cool and holds well, excellent addition to a build. Not terribly annoying to install or overly bright. For the price it's solid. Holding up my 3090 well enough

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Too small for MSI 4090 Gaming X Trio GPU
reviews.reviewText: The maximum width of the bracket is a fw mm too short to grip my MSI RTX 4090 Gamnig X Trio (whick is a pretty thick 3+ slot card). Probably is fine for thinner 40XX and 30XX series GPUs. I see that Antec has a new part# AT-GPUH-RTX4-BK that is supposedly for the RTX 4090 GPU. Amazon doesn't carry it yet - I hope they do!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as intended
reviews.reviewText: I am not a huge fan of the look because it doesn’t compliment the case and setup that I have BUT it’s functionality is absolutely worth it to keep your expensive GPU safe and not saggy. Much better than the little shock things, this is a much sturdier option 100%
Es exacto lo que necesitaba para la tarjeta de video.
